image.altText: An aerial shot of a construction site near the ocean's edge, cranes can be seen below.

props.synopsis: It’s taken 10 years, blown out by hundreds of millions of dollars, and is still nowhere near becoming operational. Now there are calls for the Darwin ship lift project to be scrapped.

title.children: Ship lift project dubbed 'one of the biggest blowouts' in Australia

image.altText: A group of primary aged kids in school uniforms walking on a red dirt road.

props.synopsis: Parents in the NT who frequently fail to send their children to school, without a valid reason, may have their income managed by the Commonwealth.

title.children: NT parents referred to income management if kids fail to attend class

image.altText: A man with a moustache and goatee and wearing a cap standing in front of a building and smiling.

props.synopsis: Darwin man Timothy Hunt has been convicted of murdering Tony Rowe, whose remains were found on the city's outskirts in May 2023, one year after he was reported missing.

title.children: Darwin man convicted of friend's murder after remains found on city's outskirts

image.altText: A damaged shop door

props.synopsis: A man is in police custody after allegedly driving a ute towards a woman and baby outside a shop in Alice Springs on Monday.

title.children: Ute narrowly misses woman, baby in alleged domestic violence attack

image.altText: A man with grey hair and a beard wearing a blue shirt sits in a chair

props.synopsis: There are growing calls for the NT government to ban machetes and crossbows as older residents share horror stories of being targeted in their own homes by armed youths.

title.children: 'I fought back as best I could': Older Territorians share home invasion horror stories

image.altText: A fifty and hundred dollar notes sit in red dirt

props.synopsis: Business owners worry major changes to a buy now, pay later system used by about 500,000 social security recipients will cause a raft of issues when it begins next month.

title.children: 'Risk of losing lots of money': Outback stores slam Centrepay changes

image.altText: An office building with at least seven floors. The building has multi-coloured cladding.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has uncovered allegations of conflicts of interest and pro-industry bias at the country's part-time regulator responsible for Australia's biggest betting companies.

title.children: Gambling regulator's alleged 'cosy relationship' with $50b betting industry

image.altText: Drone image of Elcho Island.

props.synopsis: Health workers say new data showing hepatitis B cases have almost tripled in the NT reflects better access to care, with the territory also leading the nation in reducing mortality rates.

title.children: Hepatitis B cases are rising in the NT, but experts say it's a positive sign

image.altText: Two women hugging each other, with one crying on the other’s shoulder.

props.synopsis: Rescue teams worked around the clock through narrow gaps in the rubble of Sidoarjo's Al Khoziny Islamic Boarding School while risking further collapse to reach anyone still alive.

title.children: 'Guys smashed through a wall': How school kids survived deadly quake

image.altText: firefighters carry a hiker at night in a tv screencap

props.synopsis: Hundreds of hikers are still trapped at an elevation of more than 4,900 metres as rescuers work to clear deep snow.

title.children: Hundreds of Everest hikers still awaiting rescue, 4,900 metres up

image.altText: An aerial image shows a helicopter on its back on a road surrounded by emergency vehicles.

props.synopsis: Three people have sustained critical injuries after a helicopter crashed on a Sacramento freeway in the US.

title.children: Witnesses lift helicopter, free person trapped after crash in US

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and a serious expression looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: A fractured but defiant Israel is struggling to assert itself at home and abroad, on the anniversary of a Hamas attack that triggered the current war in Gaza.

title.children: After two years of war, some Israelis feel a 'reckoning' is coming

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Police say they have conducted a "significant" aerial search of a property in South Australia's mid-north, where a four-year-old boy went missing 10 days ago.

title.children: Results of drone searches for 4yo Gus on SA property 'being analysed'

image.altText: a man standing out the front of a house holding nrl teams bulldog flags

props.synopsis: The 60-year-old accused of shooting at over a dozen random members of the public in suburban Sydney has faced a magistrate after two lawyers got into an argument over who was representing him.

title.children: Lawyers' spat as alleged Croydon Park gunman fronts court

image.altText: An adult whale and a whale calf breaching.

props.synopsis: Once hunted almost to extinction, the population of humpback whales currently migrating down Australia's east coast has bounced back and is now greater than before whaling.

title.children: These whales were hunted to 150 individuals. Now there's 50,000 of them

image.altText: a large claw clasps a row of individual copper cathode squares, with a worker at the bottom of the frame dwarfed by the cathodes

props.synopsis: Copper is an essential industrial metal, but a series of major supply disruptions this year and a lack of new mines coming online have analysts warning of shortages in coming years.

title.children: How demand and production troubles are pushing global copper prices higher

image.altText: Nick Daicos of the Magpies celebrates a goal, yelling and punching his fist in the air

props.synopsis: The reported attempts to lure Nick Daicos away from Collingwood have headlined the second day of the AFL trade period. Look back at how all the day's trade news unfolded in our blog.

title.children: Rivals reportedly launch bid to lure Nick Daicos from Collingwood

image.altText: Jaffles on a tray covered in sugar, with milk and coffee.

props.synopsis: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

title.children: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship

image.altText: Portrait of Pulp frontman Jarvis Cocker peering at camera with cross-hatch light behind him

props.synopsis: Love was "always problematic" for Jarvis Cocker, who fronts Britpop icons Pulp. But after decades of cynical songs on the subject, he's beginning to change his tune on romance.

title.children: Pulp's Jarvis Cocker has a wild wedding story few will top

image.altText: An image of Christmas lunch with ham, turkey and plenty of sides.

props.synopsis: Australians estimate Christmas costs them about $800 a year, on average, but planning ahead can reduce the financial burden.

title.children: How some simple planning can make Christmas easier financially

image.altText: A sailing boat with "Free Gaza" written on the side in red paint.

props.synopsis: The ABC has obtained details of redacted summaries prepared by Australian diplomatic staff, including allegations that one Australian citizen was slapped and had his passport "destroyed".

title.children: Australians in Israeli detention allege beatings in reports to DFAT

image.altText: Russian fighter

props.synopsis: The Australian man is accused of breaching Russia's criminal code by participating as a mercenary in an armed conflict.

title.children: Australian sentenced to jail by Russian court for fighting in Ukraine

image.altText: Man in blue hoodie smiles

props.synopsis: Matthew Daniel Whiteway was charged by Queensland Police over allegedly giving a Nazi salute in Brisbane in September.

title.children: Man likely to plead guilty to charge of allegedly giving Nazi salute

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: Australia's share market lost ground after financials, energy and mining stocks were sold off, while the gold price hit another record high. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Gold hits record high, local market loses ground — as it happened

image.altText: Doctor tools hanging on the wall of a medical consultation room.

props.synopsis: These five charts give us a glimpse into what the current state of general practice looks like in Australia.

title.children: What the Health of the Nation report tells us about GPs by numbers

image.altText: What looks like an authentic Victorian drivers licence with the name Stuart Parker and a Ramsay Street address.

props.synopsis: Neighbours fans rush to Melbourne op shops after 40 years of props, furniture and Ramsay Street relics were donated to charities.

title.children: Erinsborough High bags, Dr Karl's briefcase among tv props sent to op shop

image.altText: L4 Carlingford light rail carriage

props.synopsis: Western Sydney University has apologised to current and former students who received emails claiming their degrees have been "revoked", saying the messages are "not legitimate".

title.children: University students told degrees 'revoked' in 'fraudulent' emails

image.altText: A big industrial building

props.synopsis: Aurora Energy is seeking a $7 million bank guarantee to cover energy costs for the Boyer Mill in southern Tasmania, but the paper mill's owner says the request is "obscene".

title.children: Owner says 'obscene' demand from energy retailer threatens Australia's last paper mill

image.altText: The grey concrete front facade of a US embassy, next to black security gates, a faded red bollard and green trees

props.synopsis: Venezuela has alerted the Trump administration of a foiled "false flag operation" threatening to target the United States embassy in Caracas with explosives.

title.children: Venezuela thwarts terror attack threat against US embassy, Maduro says

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old was arrested when police found a large number of videos and messages on his phone and laptop depicting violent extremist acts, many of which were highly disturbing.

title.children: Teen found with violent extremist material driven by 'teenage bravado'

image.altText: The supermoon as it rises over Mt Coot-tha in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Our skies will be graced by up to four consecutive supermoons over the next months. Here's why they happen, and how we can end up with multiple supermoons in a row.

title.children: A trifecta of supermoons starts with tonight's harvest moon

image.altText: Sebastien Lecornu and Emmanual Macron in navy suits turned towards each other, standing besides the French and EU flag.

props.synopsis: The sudden resignation of France's prime minister — the country's fifth in two years — has put President Emmanuel Macron in a bind.

title.children: Why has France gone through five prime ministers in two years?

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and a blue shirt standing in a Melbourne laneway

props.synopsis: An industry survey finds GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients.

title.children: GP says fees will go up at his clinic when bulk-billing incentives come in

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a pink blouse sitting on a couch in a TV studio

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman who claims to be Madeleine McCann is on trial charged with stalking the missing child's parents over the past three years.

title.children: Woman claiming to be Madeleine McCann faces court
